DOC.brief_summary: To describe the natural history of the coronary atherosclerotic plaque development and progression in mild to moderate CAD over time by CCTA with demographic and laboratory data for refinement of risk stratification of patients referred for CCTA.
DOC.brief_title: Progression of AtheRosclerotic PlAque DetermIned by Computed TomoGraphic Angiography Imaging(PARADIGM)
DOC.detailed_description: All PARADIGM study patients underwent initial and follow-up CCTA based on order from their primary physician. Demographic data, targeted medical history, cardiovascular risk factors, and laboratory data was prospectively collected in electronic case report forms (eCRFs) at the time of the initial CCTA and at the time of follow-up CCTA.
DOC.criteria: patients underwent two or more clinically indicated CCTA with 64detector rows or greater for CAD evaluation patients underwent at least 2 year interval between the baseline and followup CCTA No medical history of CAD at baseline unavailable either clinical or laboratory data within 1 month from index CCTA or followup CCTA patients with prior revascularization before the index CCTA poor image quality of CCTA
